why the rally? it isn't really about the actual stocks, says cnbc stock guru Jim Cramer . it's about the end of the George H. W. Bush administration. the whole source of this rally is George H. W. Bush , meaning that each day we come closer to getting rid of him is a day where the market is better, Jim Cramer writes on bloggingstocks. stocks are being supported by something, Jim Cramer says, and there's precious little real news that's not either horrible on the face of it or not relevant to investors. the short program, despite falling on a triple flip that was to be the first part of a triple-triple jump combination. "i didn't think i would end up on top," Joannie Rochette said yesterday. but i think no one of the ladies seemed to want to skate a perfect program tonight. i'm happy with the rest of the program, but not so much about the flip. asada's combination unravelled, too. she turned a triple flip and triple loop into a triple-single, and then she doubled a triple lutz. she was still second, but had higher presentation marks than Joannie Rochette .
